cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 75 miles south of Mobile, Alabama
cyclone.trajectory: moving very slowly northward, then forecast to turn north-northeast and move inland across Alabama and Georgia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Alabama–Florida border (between Mobile Bay and Pensacola)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Bay St. Louis, MS westward to Grand Isle, LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward through the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Intermittent tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Tuesday night through Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft possible within Lake Pontchartrain and adjacent tidal lakes; minor overtopping of low wharves and river levees
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible, producing flash-flood pockets and operational slow-downs
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough surf on approaches via Mississippi River Passes; brief tornado risk in outer rain-bands
